Text: Madeleine Albright’s life story is one of resoluteness and a reflection of the bright promises of democracy. Rest in Peace to the refugee who went on to become the first woman to serve as U.S. Secretary of State. Her family and loved ones are in our prayers.

Despite unique and evolving challenges, Utah’s agricultural industry remains the lifeblood of our communities and economy. Happy #NationalAgDay to Utah’s best: our farmers and ranchers! https://t.co/H6fjStUWvn

Democrats' labor proposal would force more workers into unions that prioritize their own survival over protecting their members. Proud to join @SenatorTimScott on a better solution to protect workers, support small businesses, and encourage innovation.https://t.co/5Gnv4M96b1

For over two years, we’ve witnessed a remarkable dedication of service from the @UTNationalGuard. With its COVID-19 mission–the longest domestic support mission in its history–coming to a close, I want to offer my thanks for their monumental help with Utah’s pandemic response. https://t.co/TnqrcuOr0L

America has a responsibility to defend freedom around the world. We must get Ukraine the capabilities they need–MiG-29 jets, air defense systems, anti-tank missiles, ammunition—to fight and keep their land and skies safe. We cannot wait any longer. https://t.co/BdwROMY7mI
According to @SenMikeLee’s analysis, Biden-inflation has cost the average Utah family $582 more per month this year than last year. COVID and Biden’s spending are mostly to blame.

Federal overreach associated with public land and water usage is negatively impacting our farmers and ranchers. Met with @UtahFarmBureau members, representing nearly every county in Utah, to discuss how we can better support their work to keep our communities fed. https://t.co/41v3oPQRZI

Local leaders know the challenges and needs of their communities better than the federal government. Met with elected officials from across Utah to discuss how our cities and towns can best leverage funding and other resources from the infrastructure bill for their needs. https://t.co/R66R70Gqed

It's time for Putin to be more worried about what we might do than us to be worried about what he might do. We have got to get the people of Ukraine the aircraft and ground weapons they need to defend their country and their freedom. https://t.co/RJjjSjWwAp

Helping Ukraine isn’t only the right thing to do, but it's key to maintaining a safe and prosperous world, which is in our own interest. We must be committed to doing everything in our power to defend the people of Ukraine against the monstrous actions of Vladimir Putin. https://t.co/OM6TIcRaH1

Utah’s young people are, undoubtedly, some of the nation’s best and brightest. Great meeting with some of Utah’s exemplary youth, including members of the Clearfield Youth Council and students from St. Joseph Catholic High School, for discussions on civic engagement. https://t.co/kEYwCzkJqm

Stepping out of @ZelenskyyUa's address to Congress, I’m again moved by his monumental leadership and heroic courage. Being a world leader does indeed mean we have a responsibility to be a leader of freedom and peace. We must fulfill his request immediately. Get Ukraine the MiGs. https://t.co/hBEYXGt5ZV

Growing Utah cities face unique challenges related to modernizing and expanding infrastructure. Met with @LehiUtah and @Cityofstgeorge officials on how we can best utilize bipartisan infrastructure bill funding to support their growing economic and transportation demands. https://t.co/WpV9yQlqq4

The COVID-19 pandemic has highlighted our deficiency in medical countermeasure manufacturing. Proud my measure to allow for new capabilities for domestic surge manufacturing—for tests, PPE, vaccines, therapeutics, and the like—passed out of committee.https://t.co/q49V0SNJKT

The historic droughts facing the American West have brought new challenges to Utah’s wool producers. Met with @UTWoolGrowers to discuss ways to help mitigate these burdens and bolster Utah’s share of the global market. https://t.co/Z6dSM6vm99

Investments in Utah's infrastructure, including improvements to our public transit, are critical to address our state's growth and traffic challenges. Met with @RideUTA trustees on next steps for implementing the transit resources provided by the bipartisan infrastructure bill. https://t.co/8JL9SGrpbR

The Iranian-backed missile strike near a U.S. consulate in Iraq over the weekend is further evidence of the need for a stronger, more restrictive agreement with Iran. A weak Iran Deal would threaten our security interests in the region. https://t.co/pk1akhkGbu

This wildland fire commission will bring together some of our nation's top experts, including state and local stakeholders, to form policy recommendations and strategies on ways to better prevent, manage, suppress and recover from wildfires. To apply: https://t.co/DjSb7DkDkR

Wildfires are becoming more destructive, which is why I made sure our bipartisan infrastructure bill created a commission to improve wildfire prevention strategies. I’m looking forward to seeing the commission start its efforts. https://t.co/KLHYYkAxQJ
Congratulations to Salt Lake City’s @bren_hucks on earning another medal in snowboarding at the Beijing @Paralympics! Your remarkable determination and talent make us proud. https://t.co/l1wH1Zf6S3
While I strongly support providing Ukrainians desperately needed aid, I ultimately could not support the rest of this bloated spending bill.https://t.co/E1ZY3QtZMu

Ukraine needs MiG aircraft, and we should get it to them. @SenJoniErnst and I led a group of 40 of our colleagues in calling on the Administration to work with Poland and NATO allies to expedite the transfer of aircraft and air defense systems to Ukraine. https://t.co/Kc0vWA0Jyy

Innocent people are dying, and President Zelenskyy needs MiG aircraft to defend Ukraine against Putin’s military aggression. Enough talk–let’s get the job done so we can save lives in Ukraine and defend the cause of freedom. Send the MiGs. https://t.co/DdEKsjblsS
Live → I’m joining my colleagues to express support for transferring aircraft and military resources to Ukraine. Tune in: https://t.co/wBov0HUf4P

Putin is trying to reestablish the old boundaries of the Soviet Union, and bring more and more nations under his control. It's unacceptable. The only way to get Putin to act in a way that may be able to save the lives of Ukrainians is if he fears us more than we fear him. https://t.co/lC9AzJSrR3

President Zelenskyy and the Ukrainian forces know what's best for their own war. They know the conditions on the ground. Instead of deciding what we think is the most effective for them, we should honor their request for aircraft immediately. https://t.co/NLW876q8aY
It’s time for Putin to be fearful of what we might do. This is war. People are dying. We need to get aircraft to President Zelenskyy and the people of Ukraine immediately. https://t.co/OtLYZD3sTs

Purchasing more oil from adversaries like Iran or Venezuela, especially before furthering our own energy development domestically, is unacceptable. The Administration must now work to permit as much oil production as possible here at home to increase our resilience. https://t.co/7q5rm4WD2g

As banks face increasing uncertainty, we should ensure they are supported as they work to guarantee their services for families and businesses. Met with @UtahBankers to discuss how inflation and geopolitical tensions could affect Utah’s economic strength. https://t.co/Pd8c3woEQN

Utah is home to thousands of refugees, who each make significant and important contributions to our state. Enjoyed meeting a group of exemplary @UUtah students with refugee backgrounds who are visiting Washington, D.C. https://t.co/MLQVoOrY9J
Congratulations to Salt Lake City's @bren_hucks on an incredible performance in para snowboard cross, bringing @TeamUSA a bronze medal! Brenna, you make us proud. https://t.co/c28H26CCHA

For the third time in a row, a @TeamUSA athlete from Utah has served as flag bearer at an opening ceremony. Great seeing Park City native @DanelleUmstead waving our flag proudly in Beijing. Best of luck at the @Paralympics! https://t.co/YiSaQJUJW0

I’m eager to receive the Administration’s response to my letter asking for a full accounting of COVID money, which is necessary before we consider any additional funds. Unspent money from previous packages should be used to pay for the additional COVID funds requested by the WH. https://t.co/MLbhMYnqWh

Droughts & wildfires are becoming a greater concern for energy production in Utah. Met with @SmartEnergy1 members to discuss sustainable solutions for our community owned-power systems, including my recently-passed legislation to improve wildfire prevention & drought mitigation. https://t.co/vI2Cgk7RpJ

The @UTNationalGuard exemplifies Utah's spirit and tradition of service. Honored to sit down with Maj. Gen. Michael J. Turley, Brig. Gen. Tyler Smith, and CW5 Bryan Searcy to discuss their priorities for the coming year and how Congress can better support their mission. https://t.co/xF9O3ami96

Access to affordable, efficient and reliable energy resources is essential to maintaining Utah's economic strength. Enjoyed meeting with the Utah Municipal Power Agency, including mayors from growing Utah cities, to discuss issues critical to powering our communities. https://t.co/3rGBTymRtV

Last night, @POTUS reiterated his request for additional COVID-19 funding. We must receive a full accounting of how the government has allocated trillions in taxpayer funds to combat the pandemic before we could even consider supporting this request. https://t.co/usJwFSU3m6
My thoughts on the President’s State of the Union address: https://t.co/64YdewZ2eO

Utah’s credit unions play an important role in supporting our state’s rapidly growing economy. Spoke with members of @UtahsCUs about the current challenges facing their industry, including ways to safeguard their systems from potential cyberattacks from adversaries like Russia. https://t.co/sQrWYv7nah

A coordinated response with our allies is critical to effectively counter nefarious, autocratic regimes, like Russia and China. Met with Jane Hartley, nominee to be U.S. Ambassador to the UK & Northern Ireland, to discuss ways to further strengthen our relationships with allies. https://t.co/dpcvSDngQ3

It takes a monster to invade a neighboring country—unprovoked and unjustified—and attack its people. Vladimir Putin wants more power, at the expense of Ukrainians’ well-being. We must #StandWithUkraine and do everything in our power to support them 🇺🇦 https://t.co/MIMYOumiw2

People around the world have come together to amplify the bravery, courage, and honor of the people of Ukraine and their leader, Volodymyr Zelenskyy. I stand in solidarity with the Utahns who gathered at our State Capitol Monday evening to show their support for Ukrainians. https://t.co/Wa1NJ2wDPl

Putin’s oppressive, corrupt government is a pariah. Tonight, Utahns joined people around the world—in the spirit of freedom—to protest Russia’s hostility against the sovereignty & people of Ukraine. I’m immensely proud of our state for standing with our brave friends in Ukraine🇺🇦 https://t.co/atr1j6UYWx

Given the energy, passion, and remarkable leadership we're seeing from President Zelenskyy and the people of Ukraine, I wouldn't count them out in being able to reject Russia's aggression. https://t.co/gj9NdkzY6y
Putin is an oppressor who's been an adversary to America at every chance he's had. Americans must stand up for freedom—anything less than that is unworthy of our support. https://t.co/WsaeuYksou

Authoritarianism has been the default setting of government throughout history. To have and maintain freedom, people are required to stand up & protect it. Putin’s terrible miscalculation has sparked a remarkable commitment to freedom by the people of Ukraine & around the world. https://t.co/fXxedEYde1

The Russian government is a pariah, and the world is finally seeing Putin for what he really is: a small, evil, feral-eyed man. Nations and people around the world must continue to reject Russia's regime and fight for freedom. https://t.co/nhpt3TgKVr

Putin cowers behind his big table in what looks like a mausoleum where honesty and integrity have gone to die. Meanwhile, Zelenskyy demonstrates remarkable courage and leadership. The bravery of him and the Ukrainian people has galvanized the spirit of freedom around the world. https://t.co/pNkyqBTCQY
My statement regarding the President’s nomination of Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson to be an associate justice of the U.S. Supreme Court: https://t.co/j763aY56dL

Nearly half of Utah’s Navajo Nation does not have running water in their homes. Appreciate @SecDebHaaland's work in implementing funds provided from our bipartisan infrastructure bill to fulfill critical water needs for tribal communities in Utah.https://t.co/f5FFUCfF87

Thanks to our responsible state and local leaders, Utah remains one of the best-managed states in the country–a quality I strive to emulate in Washington. Honored to speak with the Utah legislature on our efforts to support the unique needs of our state here at home and in D.C. https://t.co/wkAYs8tbep

Americans who rely on federal programs, like Medicare and Social Security, could be cut off from their benefits if our federal trust funds go bankrupt. In order to save these programs, we must solve our imbalances. The TRUST Act is the right place to start. https://t.co/c4UnMgdtb3

Our bipartisan infrastructure bill includes clear provisions for upgraded and expanded surface transportation systems, which are critical to growing states like Utah. The Administration must implement our bill faithfully to the legislative text. https://t.co/MvyVpMqChK

Federal trust funds, which finance some of our most important federal programs, are on the brink of insolvency. For America to remain strong, we must salvage our fiscal health. Our debt must not overwhelm our nation's capacity to provide for itself and remain a global leader. https://t.co/ZaNd0jkbBv

Throughout history, a leading characteristic of failed nations has been spending excessive amounts of borrowed money. China is on track to surpass the U.S. economically, militarily, and geopolitically. To keep America strong for years to come, we must address our debt crisis. https://t.co/3YmhHX2AyD

Debt and insolvency are major threats to our nation’s security and economic wellbeing. I introduced the bipartisan TRUST Act to help us change course—establishing rescue committees to examine each of our endangered federal trust funds and develop saving solutions. https://t.co/m8F8vMQwsD

Americans are struggling with high inflation. The Administration should never have spent massive amounts of COVID relief dollars when states were already flush with funds. That, coupled with the Federal Reserve’s inaction on rates, has only worsened our nation’s fiscal crisis. https://t.co/peOVodZmz3

Congratulations to Salt Lake’s @BrittanyBowe on her bronze medal. She is a true embodiment of what it means to be a @TeamUSA Olympic athlete and a leader—and we could not be more proud 🇺🇸 https://t.co/4GufTWYvhJ

Vaccinated people are far less likely to be hospitalized or die from COVID-19, but breakthrough cases are still possible. It’s imperative that the Administration support the development of next-generation vaccines, particularly as new variants emerge.https://t.co/yQwu6KPI0y

The CCP’s atrocities against its minorities—particularly the Uyghur people—include genocide and crimes against humanity. Met with @EnesFreedom to discuss China’s human rights abuses and our shared gratitude to live in a country that honors freedom of expression. https://t.co/9HbH3phVEc

From Garland, Utah, to the skies over Berlin, ‘Candy Bomber’ Colonel Gail S. Halvorsen epitomized the defining characteristics of the Greatest Generation. May he ever remind us that hope always exists, even in our darkest hour. Rest in peace to one of the world’s finest men. https://t.co/0VZiZduzbe
Keeping these @HAFB Airmen in our prayers as they deploy to Germany. Thank you for your service and commitment to protecting our democratic values abroad. https://t.co/OwMdu4YBN0

The Uinta Basin Railway will be key to the region’s economic future. Met with Duchesne County Commissioner Greg Todd and County Recorder & @uac29 President Shelly Brennan for an update on the railway project. Grateful for their efforts to foster further economic development. https://t.co/C5X2xhI1Au
He’s unstoppable! Salt Lake City resident @NickGoepper has earned his way onto the podium in every Olympics he’s competed in. Congratulations on earning silver, Nick! https://t.co/Yt5NP2LCb0
Park City resident and @UUTah student Alex Hall could not be beaten. Alex, congratulations on an incredible run and well-deserved gold medal. You make us proud! https://t.co/Ch5ovV7Z9R
Utahns are dominating the podium in Beijing. Congratulations to Utah freestyle skiers Alex Hall and @NickGoepper on your 1-2 finish in slopestyle! https://t.co/XCrtANVgll

Because China's geopolitical power is growing at an alarming rate, we must be united with allies like Australia to maintain global order & promote our values abroad. Met with @AmbCKennedy, Amb. to Australia nominee, to discuss efforts to push back against the CCP's malign regime. https://t.co/JHeCrisEpS
Park City’s Casey Dawson found his way to the podium with a bronze medal, following a whirlwind of delays in getting to Beijing. Congratulations to Casey and the entire team! https://t.co/tUrYREZm3S

Congratulations to @UUtah alum Megan Nick on earning @TeamUSA’s second-ever medal in women’s aerial skiing! No doubt that you are helping to inspire the next generation of @usskiteam competitors. https://t.co/gTLv7xV1Cu

Utah and the American West are facing historic numbers of wildfires. The Cottonwood decision places a huge burden on the @forestservice at a time when they should be focused on wildfire management. The Administration must resolve this issue quickly. https://t.co/ZCUeHjmp75

Congratulations to @BobsledKaillie and @eamslider24 on your history-making performances in monobob! We’re immensely proud to have you both on @TeamUSA. Nothing better than hearing our national anthem played in Beijing. https://t.co/N2EO3zY1Rp

Tonight’s Super Bowl game will feature a special appearance by a F-35A from @HAFB in Utah! Especially grateful for our brave airmen as we celebrate the @usairforce’s 75 years of valiant service to our nation 🇺🇸 https://t.co/MAfaIZriEG

Congratulations to Salt Lake resident Erin Jackson on her historic win! What an amazing accomplishment, @ErinJackson480—you will be an inspiration to so many. We could not be more proud! https://t.co/EbMYnwg5Hx

Our Olympic and Paralympic athletes—including their families—have made tremendous sacrifices to compete at the Olympics. Shared an exciting moment cheering on @TeamUSA with our returned athletes and families of athletes competing now in Beijing. https://t.co/C2CF4BxPdV

It’s unequivocal—the 2002 Salt Lake Olympics had a foundational impact on winter sports here in Utah and around the world. What a wonderful evening it’s been celebrating our state’s heartening Olympic legacy with fellow Utahns. https://t.co/cDn5gjevJV

The Olympics display the greatest qualities of the human spirit. At the 2002 Games, we were continually inspired by the commitment, unity, and passion of the athletes & volunteers. Proud to join our 2002 Olympic Committee team in commemorating 20 years since the Salt Lake Games. https://t.co/zdM0gzbpHl
Congratulations to @WestminsterSLC alum @LindsJacobellis and @nickbaumgartner on making Olympic history. Your experience and hard work rewarded with a gold medal! https://t.co/RWOXkgzVll

Utah remains a national leader in job creation and business growth, and @NucorCorp is a great example of that. Enjoyed visiting their steel plant in Plymouth, UT to learn more about their approach to sustainable steel production. https://t.co/6hWY9xEcAv

Remaining competitive with China will require significant investments in our country’s manufacturing capacity—a core piece of our infrastructure bill. Grateful for @NucorCorp’s steel operation in Utah, which helps counter China’s predation in the global steel market. https://t.co/7loru0Djz2

With thousands of full-time employees in Draper and South Jordan and over 90,000 sellers throughout Utah, @eBay is a significant contributor to our state’s booming economy. Sat down with CEO Jamie Iannone to discuss ways we can better support our small e-commerce merchants. https://t.co/KDuUHloZ2F
Congratulations to Park City-based ski jumper Chris Lillis and to this amazing team for securing gold for @TeamUSA! https://t.co/rxaul6gdjR

Flawless, artistic performance from Utah’s @nathanwchen. Nathan, your efforts on and off of the ice exemplify the boundless nature of the human spirit. Congrats on gold—the Quad King delivers again! https://t.co/bRX4yRuHpc

Thanks to pro-growth policies and a talented workforce, Utah is an excellent place to start and grow a business. Enjoyed meeting with Utah's veteran-owned @blckriflecoffee to learn about their successful company and thank them for their work to support veterans in our state. https://t.co/7MnF3Sm8et

Our bipartisan infrastructure bill–now law–was designed to meet the needs of growing states like Utah. Enjoyed meeting with leadership from @WasatchCouncil to discuss how we can best implement funding & provisions from the bill for infrastructure projects along the Wasatch Front. https://t.co/ORZdsuHjkQ

Structuring federal family programs against the freedoms and best interests of parents is a huge mistake. We must ensure families can make their own choices—which is the foundation of my Family Security Act. This is critical for stronger families, culture, and a stronger economy. https://t.co/Kuc7HNvh8z

Getting the bipartisan infrastructure bill passed was a success; but now, it must be implemented as Congress intended. Met with @SecretaryPete to discuss our shared implementation objectives & I look forward to working with him to ensure that Utah's infrastructure needs are met. https://t.co/3fOfLxEIYh

Reforms to existing federal programs to help improve the lives of children and help American families must be done on a bipartisan basis. To deliver real impact, we must work together. https://t.co/g1V6PQb6Rv

Existing family programs aren’t having the kind of impact they ought to have on our children, given the amount we are spending. My Family Security Act would restructure federal programs to make them more effective at improving children's lives, without increasing spending. https://t.co/LnMTLxj462

Congratulations to @WestminsterSLC alum and Park City resident Colby Stevenson on a well-earned silver medal! @colbyskier, your grit and perseverance was put on full display in Beijing—inspiring so many. We’re immensely proud! https://t.co/WRK1eOXn2Q
Inspiring performance by @WestminsterSLC alum and 5x Olympian @LindsJacobellis. Congratulations on an incredible finish—and securing the first gold medal for @TeamUSA! https://t.co/SgLnegmY9M

Community colleges are required to report graduation rates that don’t often reflect reality. Met with @SaltLakeCC board members to discuss the Time For Completion Act, a bill to ensure reported data accurately reflect the diversity of students who attend our community colleges. https://t.co/m9CQ7rzec3

Parents deserve the right to choose how they will raise their children, whether that's having both parents in the workforce or having one stay at home. My Family Security Act prioritizes parents' choice—providing financial help without penalizing marriage or stay-at-home parents https://t.co/6BIivU2bYI

During the 2002 Winter Olympics, Utah’s spirit of service was on full display. We wondered: would we find the 25,000 volunteers needed? When we opened the application portal, we got our answer: Almost 50,000 signed up.https://t.co/aAvcVdZJDv
Thanks both to the people of Utah who volunteered and to the Olympians themselves, the 2002 Olympic Winter Games touched our hearts and inspired millions. https://t.co/dOwvDaA3zQ

The Utah spirit was on full display throughout the 2002 Games. Utahns across the state stepped forward in ways I won’t forget—serving as volunteers to ensure athletes, teams, and visitors from around the world were cared for. https://t.co/aAvcVdZJDv

Continuing in his family’s medal-winning legacy at the Winter Olympics, @WestminsterSLC alum Ryan Cochran-Siegle is taking home silver! Congratulations to Ryan on this great accomplishment. https://t.co/qOFVPLqnkC

We're still seeing a lack of capacity in medical countermeasure manufacturing—like testing—more than two years into COVID. My bill with @SenatorHassan would provide public health agencies with tools to support critical manufacturing on an ongoing basis. https://t.co/oVdrMYRU75

Breathtaking performances from @USFigureSkating. Congratulations to Utah native @nathanwchen and the entire team on this well-deserved silver! Nathan, we’ll be cheering you on as you compete in the individual events! https://t.co/9U3vBiAIaO
Congratulations to Salt Lake resident @JaeBird96 on taking home silver in women’s moguls! That was one seriously impressive—and fast—run. https://t.co/CFQnhOkytK

Utah continues to lead as the hub of winter sports—I am beyond proud that more than one third of @TeamUSA athletes have close ties to Utah. I cannot wait to see what they accomplish at the 2022 Winter @Olympics. https://t.co/r8pIQImBjV
